Professional Summary
Committed to sustainable community development and fighting climate change, bringing 5 years of outdoor and forestry experience and 2 years international experience through the Peace Corps.
Successful in project planning, community integration and development.
Knowledgeable in various environmental, forestry, and agricultural disciplines using sustainable methods.
Education in Geography and Urban Planning.

<JD_START>
Job Title: LNM Tech- HC Coffey

Location: Coffey, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
If you are currently employed at Smithfield, please log into Workday and submit your application through the Jobs Hub.

A great job-and a great future-awaits you at Smithfield Foods. We’re an $18 billion U.S. food company with nearly 60,000 employees worldwide. We’re looking for motivated people who want to join our team and grow lasting and meaningful careers with us. Join our family today. Apply Now!

Your Opportunity 

The LNM Technician provides crop management and nutrient application to farmland areas in an environmentally sound and sustainable fashion. Ensures all outdoor activities are completed to satisfy Smithfield Hog Production Division’s commitment to farm appearance and stewardship policies.

Core Responsibility

General maintenance which may include crawling under equipment or lying on the groundWeed eating, spraying, side mowing, bush hogging, discing fields - Record keepingMoving reels, pivots, linear, pumps, or other equipmentDriving tractor/mowersComply with all Safety (IPS), Bio-Security (BMS) and Environmental (EMS) management system’s rules and regulationsDaily rainfall readings, inspectionsFacilitate spill recoveries with a trash pumpWinterize equipmentAerWaying, setting up pump and suction, and pumping/transferring water or effluentAchieve certification with state as spray applicator within one (1) year of hire dateMust be on call to work in emergency situations.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.

High School diploma or GED preferred.Ability to read and speak the English languagePrevious experience with farm machinery or heavy equipment - Ability to work alone.Ability to follow instructions and deal with standardized situations.Must be able to work an average 48 hour week, which can vary frequently.Must have valid driver’s license with acceptable driving record.Weekend, evening, and holiday work required as needed.Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment. - Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics & physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbsFrequently required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl and talk or hear.Vision abilities include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus. The farm environment will include wet or humid conditions (weather related), cold and heat (weather and non-weather-related), working near moving mechanical parts, exposure to fumes or airborne particles, and chemicals.

EEO/AA Information

Smithfield is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, gender identity, protected veterans status, status as a disabled individual or any other protected group status or non-job characteristic as directed by law.

If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment selection process, please call us at 757-357-1595.

Salary Range

$19.10 - $19.85

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
